sections.heading: market; establishment; regulation
sections.text: A city of the second class shall have the power to purchase, hold, and own grounds for and to erect, establish, and regulate market houses and market places.SourceLaws 1879, § 39, VII, p. 201;Laws 1881, c. 24, § 1, p. 195;R.S.1913, § 5020;C.S.1922, § 4189;C.S.1929,

17-126.Public market; establishment; regulation.

A city of the second class shall have the power to purchase, hold, and own grounds for and to erect, establish, and regulate market houses and market places.

SourceLaws 1879, § 39, VII, p. 201;Laws 1881, c. 24, § 1, p. 195;R.S.1913, § 5020;C.S.1922, § 4189;C.S.1929, § 17-128;R.S.1943, § 17-126;Laws 2017, LB133, § 21.
